welcome_mat@zodiac.desc[1]: There is a big friendly looking welcome mat lying in front of the door.
welcome_mat@zodiac.name: welcome_mat
welcome_mat@zodiac.examine:
You can barely see some fine print under the big 
'WELCOME'.
welcome_mat@zodiac.desc[0]:
The welcome mat has been moved to the side to reveal 
nothing.

book_case_carvings@zodiac.examine:
Although the carvings are mostly neat designs, you notice that the top shelf
has writing on it that says 'Hand Crafted by Eternity'
book_case_carvings@zodiac.name: book_case_carvings

human_head@zodiac.desc[1]: There is a head mounted on the wall.  It's a human head.
human_head@zodiac.name: human_head
human_head@zodiac.examine:
It's a human head with what appear to be large claw marks on the right side 
of the face.  His eyes tell you that he was probably caught by surprise.  His
mouth appears to have somthing in it.
human_head@zodiac.desc[0]: There is a human head mounted on the wall.  It's mouth has been opened.

dirtball@zodiac.examine: It's just a simple ball of dirt.
dirtball@zodiac.desc[1]: A smooth round ball of &+ydirt &Nhas been left here on the pentagram.
dirtball@zodiac.name: dirtball
dirtball@zodiac.desc[0]: A smooth round ball of &+ydirt &Nhas been left here.

crumb_2@zodiac.name: crumb_2
crumb_2@zodiac.desc[0]: Someone dropped a rye bread crumb here.

inside_gate@zodiac.examine: There isn't much point of having this gate, is there?
inside_gate@zodiac.name: inside_gate
inside_gate@zodiac.desc[0]: The gate is open, leading west.

crumb_1@zodiac.name: crumb_1
crumb_1@zodiac.desc[0]: Someone dropped a white bread crumb here.

infinitysword@zodiac.examine: The sword has ancient markings along the blade and on the hilt.
infinitysword@zodiac.name: infinitysword
infinitysword@zodiac.desc[0]: A sword of infinite powers hovers here.

human_skin_rug@zodiac.name: human_skin_rug
human_skin_rug@zodiac.examine:
It seems that you aren't the first traveller to come this way.  Let's 
hope you don't end up like him.
human_skin_rug@zodiac.desc[0]: There is a human skin rug spread neatly on the floor.

book_case_1@zodiac.examine:
The bookcase is constructed of oak and is adorned with carvings along 
each 
shelf.
book_case_1@zodiac.desc[1]: A large oak bookcase dominates the east wall.
book_case_1@zodiac.name: book_case_1
book_case_1@zodiac.desc[0]: The bookcase has been pushed to the side revealing a void to the north.

outside_gate@zodiac.examine: This gate leads into a goat's pen.
outside_gate@zodiac.name: outside_gate

fireball@zodiac.examine: It's a ball of fire, but it doesn't feel at all hot.
fireball@zodiac.desc[1]: A ball of &+Rfire &Nhas been put on the pentagram.
fireball@zodiac.name: fireball
fireball@zodiac.desc[0]: A ball of &+Rfire &Nhas been misplaced here.

waterball@zodiac.examine: This is the sacred water of Aquarius.
waterball@zodiac.desc[1]: There is a ball of &+Bwater &Nsetting on the pentagram.
waterball@zodiac.name: waterball

pentagram@zodiac.name: pentagram
pentagram@zodiac.examine:
It's just an ordinary pentagram floating about 3 feet off the ground, 
with trays at each point.  You recognise the meaning of each point as
being &+RFire&N, &+BWater&N, &+yEarth&N, &+CAir&N, and &+WSpirit&N.

crumb_3@zodiac.name: crumb_3
crumb_3@zodiac.desc[0]: Someone dropped a wheat bread crumb here.

eternalarmor@zodiac.examine:
It has existed eternally and will continue to exist.  It looks as if it has
never been used.
eternalarmor@zodiac.name: eternalarmor
eternalarmor@zodiac.desc[0]: A suit of Eternal Armor lies here.

crumb_4@zodiac.name: crumb_4
crumb_4@zodiac.desc[0]: Someone dropped a melba bread crumb here.

chas_belt@zodiac.examine: It appears to be a very sturdy contraceptive device.
chas_belt@zodiac.name: chas_belt
chas_belt@zodiac.desc[0]: There is a chastity belt dropped here by somone who nolonger wants it.

mile_asteroid@zodiac.name: mile_asteroid
mile_asteroid@zodiac.examine:
Hmmm...it doesn't look like the printing is any language you know.
                       Arki gabblenir:20

body@zodiac.examine: It is a well and truly dead dwarf.
body@zodiac.name: body
body@zodiac.desc[0]: The mangled body of a dwarf lies here.

flag@zodiac.desc[1]: A large flag is hung neatly on the wall.
flag@zodiac.name: flag
flag@zodiac.examine:
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM                      ,                      MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM                     .M.                     MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM              .     .MMM.     .              MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM              Mm,  .MMMMM.  ,mM              MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM              qMMm,MMMMMMM,mMMq              MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM         .    "MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM"    .         MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM        .Mm.   MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM   .mM.        MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM "MMMMMMMMMMM. "MMMMMMMMMMMMM" .MMMMMMMMMMM" MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM  "MMMMMMMMMMMM.MMMMMMMMMMMMM.MMMMMMMMMMMM"  MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM   "MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM"   MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM .mMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMm. MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM    ""MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM""    MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM        ""MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM""        MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM           ""MMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM""           MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM           mMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMm           MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM                     MMM                     MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM                     MMM                     MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM                     MMM                     MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
&=WRMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM                                             MMMMMMMMMMMMMMM
flag@zodiac.desc[0]: A neatly folded flag has been carfully placed here.

crumb_7@zodiac.name: crumb_7
crumb_7@zodiac.desc[0]: Someone dropped a yummy bread crumb here.

baggie@zodiac.name: baggie
baggie@zodiac.examine: It is a very small cloth bag.
baggie@zodiac.desc[0]: There is a small bag here

airball@zodiac.examine: Now this is very difficult to describe...it is a solid ball of air!?
airball@zodiac.desc[1]: There is a very odd ball floating above the pentagram.
airball@zodiac.name: airball
airball@zodiac.desc[0]: There is a very odd ball floating at eye level here.

dictionary@zodiac.name: dictionary
dictionary@zodiac.examine:
You open the dictionary to an entry for 'co-author'.  Here's what it says:
co-author: 1n.joint author. 2v.t.be joint author. 3v.t. To sit on one's ass
like a chump, contributing nothing, but to offer to spell-check the zone once
it's completed in exchange for equil credit.

wine@zodiac.desc[1]: A bottle of fine &+Wspirit&N has been placed on the pentagram.
wine@zodiac.name: wine
wine@zodiac.examine: It's a bottle of white wine.
wine@zodiac.desc[0]: A bottle of fine &+Wspirit&N has been dropped here.

fine_print@zodiac.name: fine_print
fine_print@zodiac.examine: This zone authored by Erdirck, co-authored by Chump.

book_case_2@zodiac.examine: This is the back of the bookcase.
book_case_2@zodiac.desc[1]: The bookcase has been pushed back into place.
book_case_2@zodiac.name: book_case_2
book_case_2@zodiac.desc[0]: The bookcase has been pushed to the side.

crumb_6@zodiac.name: crumb_6
crumb_6@zodiac.desc[0]: Someone dropped a multi-grain bread crumb here.

lost7@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost7@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.

taurus@zodiac.title: The Arena
taurus@zodiac.description:
This is a huge arena used for bull fighting.  From the looks of things
the bull fighters haven't been doing too well...there is a big scoreboard on
the north wall.  It reads:

                     Bulls: 73108
                  Matadors:   190

     Well...at least it hasn't been a total annihilation.

aries@zodiac.title: The Cheerful Home of Aries
aries@zodiac.description:
Well...perhaps not so cheerful....the floor is black with ash and the
windows are curtain less.  There is no bed, nor are there any closets,
tables, or chairs.  Nothing about this place is in any way appealing to you,
lest of all the sulphurous stench that shreds at your nostrils.

lost4@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost4@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.

seastsky@zodiac.title: More Stars
seastsky@zodiac.description:
Peering to the south and to the east you can't seem to see anything
that you'd be able to get to in your lifetime...

capricorn@zodiac.title: The Goat's Pen
capricorn@zodiac.description:
Half eaten beer cans litter the pen.  The fence has been chewed away to
the point of being totally useless, but the gate remains.

frontdoor@zodiac.title: The Front Door
frontdoor@zodiac.description:
You're standing at the entrance of large mansion.  You find it odd that
there is no possible exit other than through the front door.

virgo@zodiac.title: The Virgin's Bedroom
virgo@zodiac.description:
Well, you've always wanted to get in here, but there's nothing going to
happen for you, sorry.  There is a large canopy bed here with white lace
hanging from the top.  The bed looks very soft and the light glints off 
of the satin sheets.

leo@zodiac.title: The Lion's Den
leo@zodiac.description:
Nothing seems out of place here, considering that it's owned by Leo the
lion.  A few bones lie scattered about the place, but you would have to have
expected that...perhaps what you didn't expect to see would be either the 
head on the wall, or the rug on the floor.

nwestsky@zodiac.title: More Stars
nwestsky@zodiac.description:
Peering to the north and to the west you can't seem to see anything that
you'd be able to get to in your lifetime...

library@zodiac.title: The Library
library@zodiac.description:
You find it kind of strange that this handsome room is the only room in
the house.  You wonder who might live here, and what the purpose of having a 
one room house in the middle of the space is.

southend@zodiac.title: The Far South
southend@zodiac.description:
You can just barely make out the tower you entered from in the north,
and although it is very far away, you're confident you can make it back
without a problem.  Just to the south you can see some creatures moving
about and you can hear one of them shouting 'Toro, Toro!'.

libra@zodiac.title: The House of Libra
libra@zodiac.description:
Libra's home is oddly quite a mess.  The bed is laden with dirty clothing 
and dishes sit on every available square inch of counter space.

aquarius@zodiac.title: Aquarius's Home
aquarius@zodiac.description:
This room is small and modest and is sparsely furnished.  About the only
interesting thing you see here is a small poster on the wall that reads:
     A radical is a man with both feet planted firmly in the air.
     The initials F.D.R. are printed at the bottom of the poster.

lost6@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost6@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.

lost9@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost9@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.

lost10@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost10@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.

lost12@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost12@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.    NO! Wait!!  You think you see something over to the west!

pentagram@zodiac.title: The Pentagram
pentagram@zodiac.description:
There is a large pentagram etched into the nothingness on which you 
stand.  It's floating about three feet off the ground!

lost1@zodiac.title: The Infinite Realms
lost1@zodiac.description:
You wander too far and realise that you don't know which way is back to
where you came from.

westend@zodiac.title: Near the Edge of the West Sky
westend@zodiac.description:
'Not much farther now' you keep telling yourself...and you're right.
The constalations Cancer, Scorpio, and Pisces are right after the next
mile-astroid, which you can see from here.

lost11@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost11@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.

neastsky@zodiac.title: More Stars
neastsky@zodiac.description:
You realise that you had better not venture too far away from where
you came from, since you could very easily become lost in this area.

scorpio@zodiac.title: The Dry Spot
scorpio@zodiac.description:
This is a nice dry sandy beach.  There is no ocean or anything, just like 
a small oasis of sand in this world of water.

southsky@zodiac.title: The Southern Skies
southsky@zodiac.description:
As you scan the area you suddenly feel very lonely.  There is nothing for 
miles if you were to head either east or west. Back to the north is where you
began, and while you think that's probably the best way for you to go, you
have a gut feeling that wants you to go due south.

lost3@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost3@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.

watera@zodiac.title: The Land of Water
watera@zodiac.description:
This place is lovely, however you don't like the way the ice and snow
hasn't been melted by the warm sun and air.  "BREAKING THE LAWS OF PHYSICS
ISN'T RIGHT!" you shout, but no one here seems to care.

lost2@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost2@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.

void@zodiac.title: The Void
void@zodiac.description:
You stand in the void, which is an infinitely large room.  There is
almost nothing here.

lost5@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost5@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.

northend@zodiac.title: The Far Northern Sky
northend@zodiac.description:
Only a little further north you can see the land of clean air.  You
can also see shapes moving about there, but everything about the place seems
friendly enough.

cancer@zodiac.title: The Tide Pool
cancer@zodiac.description:
It seems that the tide is permanently out here, since you can see no sign 
of an ocean, however this large tide pool does exist.  The water tastes of salt 
and there are hundreds of little minnows darting about through the colourful
water plants.

westsky@zodiac.title: The Western Skies
westsky@zodiac.description:
Just to the east is the way back home, perhaps you should go back that
way?  Looking up you can see forever, and while you realise that forever
means that it's much too big, you still have a very small part of you that
thinks you might find something up there.  It would probably be a better
idea to just stay on the path you were on.

firea@zodiac.title: Land of Fire
firea@zodiac.description:
A rather desolate place...the grass slowly burns along with several
chunks of fur that leave you to believe that the debate you were listing
to turned rather violent...perhaps a visitor is just what they need?

lost8@zodiac.title: The Infinite Void
lost8@zodiac.description:
It really doesn't seem to matter which way you go, you're still 
going to be lost.

sagittarius@zodiac.title: The Archer's Range
sagittarius@zodiac.description:
This room is about 50 meters in length, with several targets and arrows
lying about.  The grass is mostly burned away, but a few patches of green 
give hope of some life to this place.

eastend@zodiac.title: The Far Eastern Sky
eastend@zodiac.description:
Just to the east you can see the constellations governed by the power
of fire.  They seem to be having a rather heated debate.

pisces@zodiac.title: A Freshwater Pond
pisces@zodiac.description:
The massive ice floor of this place has a large pond dug into it.  There
are no plants or small fish in there at all, but the water tastes clean.

swestsky@zodiac.title: More Stars
swestsky@zodiac.description:
Peering to the south and to the west you can't seem to see anything that
you'd be able to get to in your lifetime...

aira@zodiac.title: The Fresh Air
aira@zodiac.description:
This area is beautiful!  The grass is a bright green and well manicured.
There are several well kept flower beds, one of which is a square plot with
flowers growing into a pyramid shape.

gemini@zodiac.title: Gemini's Cloud
gemini@zodiac.description:
This cloud is so perfect, it needs no decoration, and it has none.  This
place is so beautiful you feel as though if you don't leave now, you may never 
go.

eartha@zodiac.title: The Earth
eartha@zodiac.description:
This is a very small version of the Earth that you know, in fact, it
doesn't even resemble the Earth at all, it's just a small area of dirt and
grass with a big pine tree in the middle.

northsky@zodiac.title: The Northern Skies
northsky@zodiac.description:
Although your common sense tells you to go back to the south before
you get yourself totally lost, you would much rather continue searching
for whatever is is that you are looking for.

amgstars@zodiac.title: Among the Stars
amgstars@zodiac.description:
You find yourself wandering amongst the stars in the infinite night sky.
You're baffled by the incredible size of the area around you...seemingly
endless.  You could easily find yourself lost forever in these timeless 
voids.

eastsky@zodiac.title: East Sky
eastsky@zodiac.description:
Looking down to the lands of your birth, you suddenly feel incredibly
homesick, likely due to the enormous distance between you and your family.
To the west you can barely see the tower from which you entered into the 
night sky.  Far to the east you can see the constellations Aries, Leo and
Sagittarius.

gemini2@zodiac.name: Gemini2
gemini2@zodiac.description: One of the gemini twins stands before you waving happily.

sagittarius@zodiac.name: Sagittarius
sagittarius@zodiac.description: Sagittarius seems to be peeved at Leo and Aries...I wonder what they did?

scorpio@zodiac.name: Scorpio
scorpio@zodiac.description: A massive scorpion stares at you poised to strike.

libra@zodiac.name: Libra
libra@zodiac.description: An almost perfectly balanced person stands before you.

taurus@zodiac.name: Taurus
taurus@zodiac.description: Taurus is tired of all the bull$#it that goes on in this place.

aquarius@zodiac.name: Aquarius
aquarius@zodiac.description: A young woman stands here holding water without a container.

aries@zodiac.name: Aries
aries@zodiac.description: A large ram glares at you.

gemini1@zodiac.name: Gemini1
gemini1@zodiac.description:
One of the gemini twins stands before you smiling 
happily.

eternity@zodiac.name: Eternity
eternity@zodiac.examine: Nothing could possibly confuse you more than seeing everything at once.
eternity@zodiac.description: Eternity, the god of time, towers above you in his eternal silence.

capricorn@zodiac.name: Capricorn
capricorn@zodiac.description: Capricorn doesn't look like he's having a good day...boy does he look mad!

nightwing@zodiac.name: Nightwing
nightwing@zodiac.examine: She is the master of this place.
nightwing@zodiac.description:
No other hunter has the power or the grace of Nightwing.  She was about to
feast on her latest kill until you disturbed her.

virgo@zodiac.name: Virgo
virgo@zodiac.description:
A young virgin sits here on the bed.
Virgo winks suggestively at you.

hellhound@zodiac.name: Hellhound
hellhound@zodiac.examine: He is pure white with the exception of pink staining around his jaw.
hellhound@zodiac.description: A Hellhound wanders the area in search of a soul to feed on.

infinity@zodiac.name: Infinity
infinity@zodiac.examine:
Looking into him, you see everything that has existed and all that will,
unfortunately, it is far too much for you to comprehend.
infinity@zodiac.description:
All that exists radiates from Infinity, who stands several inches above the
floor.

leo@zodiac.name: Leo
leo@zodiac.description: Leo looks &=lrvery&n happy to see you!

cancer@zodiac.name: Cancer
cancer@zodiac.description: Cancer looks really crabby today...better stay out of his way!
